intro: [WRONG START] Asteleia nervosa var. australiana, commonly known as the New Zealand flat sedges, is a perennial plant native to New Zealand. It is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with narrow, linear leaves that form dense clumps. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically clustered in spikelets at the ends of the stems. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands, streambanks, and other damp habitats. Astelia nervosa var. australiana plays an important ecological role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various invertebrates.
